lines.text: Man who have gun either afraid or have guilty conscience.
You'll be harder to see in the dark if you go in.
Well, don't rush me - don't rush me.
Now, don't turn on any lights.
Don't you worry any. I ain't. I'm gonna blend in with that darkness.

[Referring to Charkie]
Well, I guess the old man knows what he's doin'. but sometimes I wish he'd take us more into his confidence.
Pat, my boy, for ways that are dark and tricks that are vain, Mr. Chan is very peculiar... Shakespeare.

[to Lt. Ruark]
Surprised detective might just as well clutch iron ball and jump in lake.

[after hearing his name called from a cell]
Well, Willie Best, how are you? I'm glad to see you. What are you doin'?
Oh, I see what you mean. Maybe I can get you out. I got an "in" around here.
I don't need no "in." I'm already in. I wanna get out.
